title: King Claudius

properties.name: description
properties.value: King Claudius Remanis was once a ruler of Varrock, the capital city of the kingdom of Misthalin. Although the time of his rule is unknown, it is believed he lived some time in the Fourth Age. He does not appear in-game, but is mentioned in issue 4 of Postbag from the Hedge.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:King Claudius
 This article contains information only featured in Postbag from the Hedge.
Postbags released during the RuneScape 2 era (2005-07) are generally not considered canon, unless otherwise mentioned. Postbags released during the Old School era (since 2021) are generally considered canon.

King Claudius Remanis was once a ruler of Varrock, the capital city of the kingdom of Misthalin. Although the time of his rule is unknown, it is believed he lived some time in the Fourth Age. He does not appear in-game, but is mentioned in issue 4 of Postbag from the Hedge.

According to Duke Horacio of Lumbridge, King Claudius granted his (Duke Horacio's) ancestor Polonius the title of duke in exchange for his service as a vassal in the service of Misthalin. Polonius would later go on to establish Lumbridge Castle in the place of a wooden fort that had previously served as a lone defensive structure. His position of duke was later passed on through the generations.[1]

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Claudius and Polonius are names from the Shakespeare play, Hamlet.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Postbag 4 - "Transcript:Goblins, globes and golems!", Letter 3, by Duke Horacio. Old School RuneScape Postbags from the Hedge.
Predecessor Title Successor
None Ruler of Misthalin Unknown (eventually King Roald I)
